attributes.description: Windows network interfaces with DHCP/DNS configuration. Combines interface_details and interface_addresses for comprehensive network inventory including DHCP server, lease times, DNS settings. Useful for asset discovery, baseline configuration, detecting rogue DHCP servers, DNS hijacking, and unauthorized network adapters.
attributes.query:
-- Windows network interface inventory with DHCP/DNS configuration
-- Source: interface_details + interface_addresses
-- Use case: Asset discovery, rogue DHCP detection, DNS hijacking, unauthorized adapters
WITH interface_info AS (
    SELECT
        id.interface AS interface_name,
        id.friendly_name,
        id.description,
        UPPER(REPLACE(id.mac, ':', '-')) AS mac_address,
        id.mtu,
        id.speed AS link_speed,
        id.flags,
        CASE WHEN id.last_change > 0 THEN datetime(id.last_change, 'unixepoch') ELSE NULL END AS last_change_time,
        id.ibytes AS bytes_received,
        id.obytes AS bytes_sent,
        id.ipackets AS packets_received,
        id.opackets AS packets_sent,
        id.enabled,
        id.dhcp_enabled,
        id.dhcp_server,
        CASE WHEN id.dhcp_lease_obtained IS NOT NULL AND id.dhcp_lease_obtained != '' THEN SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_obtained, 1, 4) || '-' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_obtained, 5, 2) || '-' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_obtained, 7, 2) || 'T' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_obtained, 9, 2) || ':' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_obtained, 11, 2) || ':' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_obtained, 13, 2) || 'Z' ELSE NULL END AS dhcp_lease_obtained_time,
        CASE WHEN id.dhcp_lease_expires IS NOT NULL AND id.dhcp_lease_expires != '' THEN SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_expires, 1, 4) || '-' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_expires, 5, 2) || '-' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_expires, 7, 2) || 'T' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_expires, 9, 2) || ':' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_expires, 11, 2) || ':' || SUBSTR(id.dhcp_lease_expires, 13, 2) || 'Z' ELSE NULL END AS dhcp_lease_expires_time,
        id.dns_server_search_order,
        id.dns_domain,
        id.dns_host_name,
        id.connection_status
    FROM interface_details id
)
SELECT
    i.interface_name,
    i.friendly_name,
    i.description,
    i.mac_address,
    ia.address AS ip_address,
    ia.mask AS netmask,
    ia.type AS address_type,
    i.mtu,
    i.link_speed,
    i.flags,
    i.last_change_time,
    i.bytes_received,
    i.bytes_sent,
    i.packets_received,
    i.packets_sent,
    i.enabled,
    i.dhcp_enabled,
    i.dhcp_server,
    i.dhcp_lease_obtained_time,
    i.dhcp_lease_expires_time,
    i.dns_server_search_order,
    i.dns_domain,
    i.dns_host_name,
    i.connection_status
FROM interface_info i
LEFT JOIN interface_addresses ia ON i.interface_name = ia.interface
ORDER BY i.interface_name, ia.address
